title: Lula defeats Bolsonaro in Brazil's runoff election
description: With 98.8% of the votes tallied Sunday, leftist candidate Luiz Inácio da Silva had 50.8% and far-right Jair Bolsonaro 49.2%. The election authority said Lula’s victory was a mathematical certainty.

title: Gilles Simon: 'Tennis embodies the loser side of French sport'
description: After a 20-year professional career, the 37-year-old former world No. 6 tennis player will retire at the end of the Rolex Paris Masters, which starts on Monday.

title: Russia's exit from grain deal makes Ukraine exports 'impossible'
description: The European Union urged Moscow to rejoin the deal, as the US accuses the country of 'weaponizing food.'

title: 'I drank the Bordeaux of the future'
description: A surprisingly rejuvenated Pessac-Léognan, where the fruit is fully expressed: Château Couhins-Lurton is leading the Bordeaux appellation in a new direction, with stunning results.

title: Intelligence agents mix with students at elite French university
description: The Sciences Po campus in Saint-Germain-en-Laye offers a one-year course on jihadism, organized crime and cyber security, allowing students to interact with professionals in a very closed environment.

title: At least 32 dead, many injured after India bridge collapse
description: A suspension bridge collapsed in India, plunging hundreds of people into the Mahchu river.

title: 'House of the Dragon' season finale ends in pitch-black darkness
description: In contrast to 'Rings of Power,' the 'Game of Thrones' prequel has found a way to triumph by basking in doom and gloom.

title: Man throws petrol bombs at Dover migrant center
description: A news photographer said a man threw three three gas bombs at the center before driving away and killing himself, although his death remains unconfirmed by the police.

title: Mondrian: the painting that has been hanging upside down for over 70 years
description: The painting, titled 'New York City I', will continue to be hung the wrong way around to avoid damaging it.

title: Lebanon President Aoun leaves office amid economic crisis, no replacement
description: Michel Aoun vacated Lebanon's presidential palace on Sunday with no replacement, threatening to deepen the country's economic crisis.

title: Brazil votes in down-to-wire Bolsonaro-Lula showdown
description: Brazilian voters head to the polls to choose between the country's two political titans in a polarizing vote for the country's next president.

title: The exodus of Cuba's last independent journalists to Spain
description: In recent months, almost all the last independent Cuban journalists who had resisted the regime's harassment have gone into exile.

title: Barack Obama is on the campaign trail for Democrats ahead of US midterms
description: The former Democratic president headlined rallies in Georgia, Michigan and Wisconsin the past week, heading to Atlanta to support incumbent Senator Raphael Warnock and local left-wing celebrity and gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams.

title: EU urges Russia to rejoin grain deal as US accuses Moscow of 'weaponizing food'
description: The latest tensions come after Russia accused Ukraine and the UK of a drone attack on its Crimea fleet. Kyiv and the UN have urged for the grain deal to remain in force.

title: Witnesses describe scenes of horror in Seoul after Halloween stampede
description: At least 150 people were killed and around 80 injured when a large crowd surged in a narrow alley of Seoul's lively Itaewon district.

title: South Korea in national mourning after deadly Halloween crush kills more than 150
description: The first Halloween festivities since 2019 and the coronavirus pandemic had attracted nearly 100,000 people to Itaewon, a party district in the center of the South Korean capital.

title: The former Ukrainian entertainer who is crowdfunding the counter-offensive
description: Ukrainian Serhiy Prytula put aside his media career to help Ukraine in its war effort. Through his foundation, Prytula has generated nearly €83 million to help the Ukrainian army acquire military equipment.

title: We must rescue women's sexuality from shame
description: Whether they consent or not, women are very often made to feel guilty when it comes to sexuality and seduction. According to 'Le Monde' columnist Maïa Mazaurette, shame must urgently swap to the other side .

title: Who owns Frida Kahlo? Her family fights to reclaim her image
description: The Mexican artist's descendants and a Panama company, which owns the brand in her name, are battling over the enormous financial windfall from 'Fridamania.'

title: Brazil: Deforestation in the Amazon can be traced to Jair Bolsonaro's policies
description: In one year, a record 13,000 km2 of tropical forest have disappeared. The government now says it wants to act, but its environmental record suggests otherwise.

title: Lula vs. Bolsonaro: What's at stake in Brazil's election?
description: Brazilians will vote on Sunday in the final round of Brazil's presidential elections. Polls suggest veteran leftist Lula holds a slight advantage over far-right incumbent Bolsonaro, the split representing a growing divide in the nation.

title: Elon Musk, Bill Gates... 'We need to imagine new ways to control the propensity of billionaires to replace the State'
description: Thanks to their financial clout, Elon Musk and Bill Gates are behind more and more initiatives in the geopolitical, health and climate fields, thereby weakening democracies and international organizations, says 'Le Monde' columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: On the border between Poland and Belarus lies the specter of a new humanitarian and migration crisis
description: The fence built by Poland in response to the influx of migrants in 2021 has not prevented Russia from continuing to use immigration as a weapon to destabilize Europe.

title: Pelosi 'heartbroken and traumatized' over attack on husband
description: An intruder had broken into the couple's house in San Francisco early Friday morning and attacked the speaker's husband Paul Pelosi with a hammer, fracturing his skull. 'His condition continues to improve,' Nancy Pelosi said Saturday evening.

title: Electric or conventional bicycle: What is best for our health?
description: According to a German study, conventional cyclists spend more time in the saddle and practice at a higher intensity than users of electric-assist models.

title: Tiger mosquitoes, vectors of dengue fever, are thriving in France this autumn
description: Boosted by the exceptionally warm weather, the mosquitoes are continuing to spread and are now present in 70 French departments.
